info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 3:10PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Caldwell and central Burke Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 310 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles north of Morganton, or 5 miles east of Table Rock, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lenoir, Morganton, Valdese, Gamewell, Cajah`s Mountain, Drexel, Rutherford College, Lake Rhodhiss, Table Rock and Glen Alpine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
